job.title: Job Title: Full-Stack Developer – Lead for Waste Management Beneficial Reuse Platform
job.description:
Type: Full-Time

Start Date: ASAP

Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Full-Stack Developer to lead the development and management of our innovative waste management beneficial reuse platform. This role is pivotal in transitioning the project from its initial phase, currently developed in a low code bubble environment, to full-scale application development.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the completion of phase one and spearhead the full-scale creation of the application.
Collaborate closely with our team to strategize the development process.
Play a crucial role in hiring and managing a dedicated team or company for development work.
Ensure seamless integration and functionality of databases and logistics components within the platform.
Provide expert guidance and insights throughout the development lifecycle.
Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer.
Strong background in both front-end and back-end development.
Ability to lead a project from conception to final product.
Experience with low-code platforms, particularly Bubble.
Familiarity with database management and logistics software.
Excellent leadership skills, with experience in team management and strategy development.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under tight deadlines.

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for a Full-Stack Developer – Lead for our Waste Management Beneficial Reuse Platform. This is a long-term project of more than 6 months. 

As the lead developer, you will be responsible for overseeing the development and maintenance of our platform. The ideal candidate should have expertise in HTML, Web Design, .NET Framework, Low Code & RAD Software, App Development, Adobe Photoshop, Google Analytics, Bubble.io, and Web Application.

To apply for this position, please submit a proposal outlining how you can contribute to the project. Please include any relevant experience and past projects you have completed. We encourage you to provide links or samples of your work to demonstrate your skills and expertise.

We look forward to reviewing your proposal and discussing further details of the project.
